title: Young woman found dead southeast of Taos
content:
A 17-year-old woman was found dead in her vehicle July 24 at the Talpa Reservoir located southeast of Taos, according to Taos County Sheriff Jerry Hogrefe.
A sheriff's deputy responded to a call about a vehicle located at the reservoir, which was still running. The deputy found the woman inside with a single gunshot wound to the head.
Hogrefe said there was no indication of foul play and that the case is active.
The sheriff's department said the woman was a ward of the state who had been placed in foster care. She had apparently had permission to visit other family away from her home the night of July 23, and never returned.
A gathering has been organized for those looking for support surrounding recent deaths in the Taos area. Read the story here.
Check back to taosnews.com for updates.
